attributes.name: noAnimations
attributes.description:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

attributes.name: allowOutsideScroll
attributes.description:
By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
to itself when opened.
Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
to the dropdown when it opens.
This property is a shortcut to set `scrollAction` to lock or refit.
Prefer directly setting the `scrollAction` property.

attributes.name: opened
attributes.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

attributes.name: withBackdrop
attributes.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

attributes.name: noAutoFocus
attributes.description:
Set to true to disable auto-focusing the overlay or child nodes with
the `autofocus` attribute` when the overlay is opened.

attributes.name: noCancelOnEscKey
attributes.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

attributes.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
attributes.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

attributes.name: restoreFocusOnClose
attributes.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

attributes.name: allowClickThrough
attributes.description:
Set to true to allow clicks to go through overlays.
When the user clicks outside this overlay, the click may
close the overlay below.

attributes.name: alwaysOnTop
attributes.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

attributes.name: scrollAction
attributes.description:
Determines which action to perform when scroll outside an opened overlay
happens. Possible values: lock - blocks scrolling from happening, refit -
computes the new position on the overlay cancel - causes the overlay to
close

attributes.name: noOverlap
attributes.description:
Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping
it.

attributes.name: horizontalAlign
attributes.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the `positionTarget`. Possible values are "left", "right",
"center", "auto".

attributes.name: verticalAlign
attributes.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the `positionTarget`. Possible values are "top", "bottom",
"middle", "auto".

attributes.name: dynamicAlign
attributes.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as
preferred alignment and if there's not enough space, it will pick the
values which minimize the cropping.

attributes.name: horizontalOffset
attributes.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `horizontalAlign`.

If `horizontalAlign` is "left" or "center", this offset will increase or
decrease the distance to the left side of the screen: a negative offset
will move the dropdown to the left; a positive one, to the right.

Conversely if `horizontalAlign` is "right", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the right side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown to the right; a positive one, to the left.

attributes.name: verticalOffset
attributes.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `verticalAlign`.

If `verticalAlign` is "top" or "middle", this offset will increase or
decrease the distance to the top side of the screen: a negative offset
will move the dropdown upwards; a positive one, downwards.

Conversely if `verticalAlign` is "bottom", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the bottom side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown downwards; a positive one, upwards.

attributes.name: autoFitOnAttach
attributes.description: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

attributes.name: fitPositionTarget
attributes.description: Set to true to fit dropdown content width to dropdown selector

attributes.name: disabled
attributes.description: If true the button is a toggle and is currently in the active state.

attributes.name: focused
attributes.description: If true the element currently has focus.

properties.name: openAnimationConfig
properties.description:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
opening of the dropdown. Pass an Array for multiple animations.
See `neon-animation` documentation for more animation configuration
details.

properties.name: closeAnimationConfig
properties.description:
An animation config. If provided, this will be used to animate the
closing of the dropdown. Pass an Array for multiple animations.
See `neon-animation` documentation for more animation configuration
details.

properties.name: focusTarget
properties.description:
If provided, this will be the element that will be focused when
the dropdown opens.

properties.name: noAnimations
properties.description:
Set to true to disable animations when opening and closing the
dropdown.

properties.name: allowOutsideScroll
properties.description:
By default, the dropdown will constrain scrolling on the page
to itself when opened.
Set to true in order to prevent scroll from being constrained
to the dropdown when it opens.
This property is a shortcut to set `scrollAction` to lock or refit.
Prefer directly setting the `scrollAction` property.

properties.name: containedElement
properties.description: The element that is contained by the dropdown, if any.

properties.name: opened
properties.description: True if the overlay is currently displayed.

properties.name: withBackdrop
properties.description:
Set to true to display a backdrop behind the overlay. It traps the focus
within the light DOM of the overlay.

properties.name: noAutoFocus
properties.description:
Set to true to disable auto-focusing the overlay or child nodes with
the `autofocus` attribute` when the overlay is opened.

properties.name: noCancelOnEscKey
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay with the ESC key.

properties.name: noCancelOnOutsideClick
properties.description: Set to true to disable canceling the overlay by clicking outside it.

properties.name: closingReason
properties.description:
Contains the reason(s) this overlay was last closed (see
`overlay-closed`). `ArcOverlayMixin` provides the `canceled`
reason; implementers of the behavior can provide other reasons in
addition to `canceled`.

properties.name: restoreFocusOnClose
properties.description: Set to true to enable restoring of focus when overlay is closed.

properties.name: allowClickThrough
properties.description:
Set to true to allow clicks to go through overlays.
When the user clicks outside this overlay, the click may
close the overlay below.

properties.name: alwaysOnTop
properties.description: Set to true to keep overlay always on top.

properties.name: scrollAction
properties.description:
Determines which action to perform when scroll outside an opened overlay
happens. Possible values: lock - blocks scrolling from happening, refit -
computes the new position on the overlay cancel - causes the overlay to
close

properties.name: sizingTarget
properties.description:
The element that will receive a `max-height`/`width`. By default it is
the same as `this`, but it can be set to a child element. This is useful,
for example, for implementing a scrolling region inside the element.

properties.name: fitInto
properties.description: The element to fit `this` into.

properties.name: noOverlap
properties.description:
Will position the element around the positionTarget without overlapping
it.

properties.name: positionTarget
properties.description:
The element that should be used to position the element. If not set, it
will default to the parent node.

properties.name: horizontalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element horizontally
relative to the `positionTarget`. Possible values are "left", "right",
"center", "auto".

properties.name: verticalAlign
properties.description:
The orientation against which to align the element vertically
relative to the `positionTarget`. Possible values are "top", "bottom",
"middle", "auto".

properties.name: dynamicAlign
properties.description:
If true, it will use `horizontalAlign` and `verticalAlign` values as
preferred alignment and if there's not enough space, it will pick the
values which minimize the cropping.

properties.name: horizontalOffset
properties.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `horizontalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `horizontalAlign`.

If `horizontalAlign` is "left" or "center", this offset will increase or
decrease the distance to the left side of the screen: a negative offset
will move the dropdown to the left; a positive one, to the right.

Conversely if `horizontalAlign` is "right", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the right side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown to the right; a positive one, to the left.

properties.name: verticalOffset
properties.description:
A pixel value that will be added to the position calculated for the
given `verticalAlign`, in the direction of alignment. You can think
of it as increasing or decreasing the distance to the side of the
screen given by `verticalAlign`.

If `verticalAlign` is "top" or "middle", this offset will increase or
decrease the distance to the top side of the screen: a negative offset
will move the dropdown upwards; a positive one, downwards.

Conversely if `verticalAlign` is "bottom", this offset will increase
or decrease the distance to the bottom side of the screen: a negative
offset will move the dropdown downwards; a positive one, upwards.

properties.name: autoFitOnAttach
properties.description: Set to true to auto-fit on attach.

properties.name: fitPositionTarget
properties.description: Set to true to fit dropdown content width to dropdown selector

properties.name: disabled
properties.description: If true the button is a toggle and is currently in the active state.

properties.name: focused
properties.description: If true the element currently has focus.

events.name: opened
events.description: Dispatched after the element is rendered opened

events.name: closed
events.description: Dispatched after the element is rendered closed

events.name: cancel
events.description: Dispatched when element is about to be closed. Cancelling the event stops the closing.
